head.supplied: [Mr Teijsmann tables a letter addressed to him, dated 25 October this year, from the member Dr F. Mueller in Melbourne, from which it appears that the Society, in order to obtain his works, will have ...

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: Letter not found. For the text given here, see minutes of the meeting of the Executive of the Koninklijke Natuurkundige Vereeniging in Nederlandsch-Indië held on 11 November 1865, Natuurkundig tijdschrift voor Nederlandsch Indië, vol. 29 (1866), pp. 415-6.

p.seg: [Der heer Teijsmann brengt ter tafel een aan hem gerigt schrijven, dd. 25 Okt. jl., van het lid dr. F. Mueller te Melbourne, waaruit blijkt dat de vereeniging zich, ter bekoming van zijne geschriften, zal hebben te wenden tot den chief secretary of the Victorian Government.]

[Mr Teijsmann tables a letter addressed to him, dated 25 October this year, from the member Dr F. Mueller in Melbourne, from which it appears that the Society, in order to obtain his works, will have to contact the chief secretary of the Victorian Government.]

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: The Executive resolved 'zich ter zake tot die autoriteit te wenden' [to turn to that authority on the matter]. The Secretary of the Society, W. F. Versteeg, wrote to Melbourne the next day and the Undersecretary of the Chief Secretary's Department, J. Moore, replied on 6 February 1866 that the requested copies of Mueller's works were being sent (N808, no. 389, p. 32, unit 11, VPRS 1187/P outward correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria). The books were reported as received at the meeting of the Society's Executive on 18 May 1866 (Natuurkundig tijdschrift voor Nederlandsch Indië, vol. 29 (1866), pp. 473).
